definition: residence/(coll.) to stay in at home/to hang around at home

sentences.english: Like historic homes, many cities also have historic sites.
sentences.chinese: 像古宅一样，许多城市也有历史古迹。

sentences.english: It is rumored that this old house is home to a number of long-haired ghosts.
sentences.chinese: 谣传这栋古宅是一些长发鬼聚集的地方。

sentences.english: Ancient town house yard deep, small bridges yoyo.
sentences.chinese: 镇上古宅庭院深深，小桥流水悠悠。

sentences.english: Old man the thou is hard to forget according to the feeling of the departure of a hundred years mutually.
sentences.chinese: 老人古宅相依百年离别之情难以忘怀。

sentences.english: Many of these are beautifully restored to their original glory.
sentences.chinese: 许多古宅都被修复到其原始的繁荣模样。

sentences.english: The restoration of the ancient mansion is more beautiful than the original.
sentences.chinese: 这座重建的古宅比原来的更好看。

sentences.english: Strange events transpired in the old mansion many years ago.
sentences.chinese: 数年前这座古宅里曾经发生过很多奇怪的事情。

definition: courtyard house with a fully enclosed courtyard (type of Chinese residence)
interesting and appealing (of old locations, objects etc)
residence consisting of structures surrounding a courtyard on three sides
Lao Cai, Vietnam/Laokai or Laukkai, Burma (Myanmar)
courtyard/atrium/opening in a roof/skylight/caisson ceiling/(TCM) acupuncture point TB10
